oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Khiḍir Asʻad Abū Hawwāsh
مقابلة مع خضر أسعد أبو هواش
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Symbolism in fairy tales
Fables, Arabic--Palestine
Short stories, Arabic--Palestine
Kings and rulers--Fiction
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Camels; Damascus (Syria); Death; Dinners and dinning; Egypt; Escape; Food; Fortune-tellers; Graveyards; Hospitality; Inheritance; Judges; Money; Shaykhs; Sons; Thieves; Travel; Animals; Beheading; Cheating; Conduct of life; Death; Domestic violence; Ducks; Executions; Friendship; Government officials; Hunters; Killing; Kings; Love; Machination; Manipulation; Marriage; Mothers; Punishment; Queens; Rape; Rumors; Travel; Wives; Work; Animals; Beheading; Carriages; Cheating; Chivalry; Damascus (Syria); Diseases; Egypt; Humiliation; Injuries; Kings; Knights; Lion; Machination; Manipulation; Money; Stupidity; Water resources; Wisdom
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on April 3, 1997 with Khiḍir Asʻad Abū Hawwāsh, male, born in1947 in Yaʻbad, Palestine and resides in al-Rashidīyah Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع خضر أسعد أبو هواش في 3 نيسان أبريل عام 1997، ذكر، ولد عام 1947 في يعبد، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم الرشيدية للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
